intro: Machaerina restioides var. effusa, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers in clusters at the base of the leaves. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical significance, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional Māori crafts.
